title: Q3 - Do SDFs have to appoint their Data Protection Officer (DPO) in India, even if they are a multinational company headquartered elsewhere?
description: Yes. Under Section 10(2)(a)(ii) of the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023 (DPDPA), every Significant Data Fiduciary (SDF) is legally required to appoint a Data Protection Officer (DPO) who is based in India, regardless of where the companyâ€™s global headquarters or parent entity is located.
